empty.  Sam and Barbara are gone. Kelly continues to stare.
What are you looking at?
(starting the car) Nothing.
The Atlantic rolls before a long stretch of empty sand as last red light drains from the sky. The Range Rover comes down onto the sand, parks.
Kelly turns off the engine.  Suzie tokes on a joint, swil MD 20/20.  She gazes upon the sea, eyes at half-mast.
I thought we were goin' to a movie.
I think we just need to get wasted.
Suzie shrugs, gets out.  Kelly gets out with her.  Suzie staggers.  Kelly circles her with an arm, looks nervously begins leading her down the beach.
I wanna live at the beach someday.
Shit.
She stops walking.  Suzie takes a few more steps then tur look at her.
I left the keys.  I'll get 'em.
Suzie plops down on the sand, drinks from the bottle.  Sh watches Kelly fading into the darkness, mumbles something her breath, then lies on her back.
The SOUND of CRASHING WAVES.  She rolls to one side, look the beach Murky blackness. She tries to focus, sits up.
Kelly?
She stands -- wobbly -- peers down the beach. A shape EMERGES in the blackness, moving toward her.
Kelly?

The shape gets closer and closer, until... Sam Lombardo steps up to loom over Suzie. She takes a step back. Sam puts a hand on her shoulder.  He carries something in other hand -- hard to see on the dark beach.
Suzie, it's okay.  It's me.
Suzie steadies herself.  A face APPEARS behind Sam -- Kel
I was worried about you, Suzie.  I decided we should all get together, one more time, before we split up.
Are you mad at me?
No, no.  Look, I probably should have told you a little more, about the part I intended to play. (beat) We'll go through it all again tonight.
Sam takes the bottle from Suzie, looks at it.
This is a celebration Suzie, not a suicide pact.
He lifts the object in his other hand -- a champagne batt
We'll chill out first, have a drink, watch the stars.
Suzie nods.
Kelly, there's a beach blanket in the Jeep.  Could you get it for us?
Kelly nods, starts back, looks once over her shoulder as. Sam leads Suzie toward a huge rock formation.
Let me tell you about this boat I picked out for us...
They move OUT OF SIGHT.  Kelly continues to walk, back al sand toward the cars.

A sickening hollow THWACK -- an arc of blood and two teet silently on dark stone. Kelly begins to run, stumbling through the sand to Sam's where she pulls a big roll of clear plastic from behind t seats.  She stuffs it under her arm, then runs back along beach.  As she runs, she can hear them -- more THWACKS, M it seems like forever Sam APPARS before her on the sand.  The champagne bottle loosely at the end of one arm.  it looks shiny now, dripp Suzie's blood. Kelly goes to him.  She looks at the bottle, then throws against him -- a hard kiss.
I'm sorry, Kelly.  I'm sorry it had to happen like this.  She was losing it...
(breathless) There was no way.  That cop would've gotten her to tell him... everything. She was weak and dumb...

She kisses him again, her hands moving over his body.  Sa a step back, looks into Kelly's face -- the parted lips, eyes -- as if seeing her for the first time -- a long bea which point he turns, heaving the champagne bottle as far can into the black waves.
Rear hatch open -- overhead light on. Sam and Kelly drag Suzie's body -- wrapped in the plastic the rear hatch.  As they heft her inside, the light catch

A mask of blood. Kelly turns away in disgust.  She goes to the passenger s door, gets in. Sam gets in behind the wheel.  For a moment the two of th sit there, in the darkness, with the SOUND of the SEA, an own BREATHING.  Sam looks at Kelly. She is focused on the dark Atlantic.
Are you okay?
Kelly turns to him -- an anxious face.
(a long beat) My mom would kill me if she knew I took the Rover.
Kelly waits by the Rover, swatting mosquitoes. SLOSHING SOUNDS -- a shape approaches in the dark -- Sam waders, muddy, tired, carrying a shovel.
Almost empty of cars.  The Range Rover cruises past Suzie circles, comes back.  Sam jumps out, pulls on latex glove into the VW and backs it out.
Almost dawn.  A long parking lot fronts the terminal.  Su arrives, parks, Sam gets out.  He goes to the waiting Ran Rover, gets in and drives away.

head_text.subj: A THIN STREAM OF MUDDY WATER

text: flows beneath the gate, down the drive, toward the street A HAND touches the water. PULL BACK to REVEAL the hand as that of Ray Duquette.

Ray kneels, fingers wriggling in the water, then straight looking toward the house where... On the other side of the gate, Kelly, in a tube-top and t shorts, washes mud from the Range Rover.  She looks up, s Ray, drying his hand on a handkerchief, walking up the dr arriving at the wrought-iron gates.
Been four-wheelin'?
Kelly freezes -- not so cool this time.
Get off my property.
I'm not on your property!
He grabs the wrought-iron gate -- rattles it -- harder an harder. Kelly backs away, frightened.
Gloria and Ray stand in front of the ramshackle wooden bu talking to Ruby.  Walter sits nearby, sharpening a knife.
You say she didn't come back last night.
She's been sayin' she was going to go to L.A.  But I don't know.  I mean all her clothes are still here.  An' she's missin' her graduation. (a long beat) She should graduate.  She's a smart girl...
Ray nods.  He makes a note in his pad.
May have been she just partied too much... But we'll look into it.  We find something, you'll be the first to know.
Ray turns and walks to the car.  Gloria follows.
Ray sits for a moment behind the wheel.
It's starting, Gloria.  This is how it begins...
Ray.  We don't know anything yet.  She could be anywhere...
Ray silences her with a look.
I'm gonna take you back to the office. Will you put out a call on Suzie's car for me?
You have someplace to be?
Ray starts the car, doesn't answer.
If you want company...
Just check out the car.
Gloria nods.  She looks toward the camp store where the o can still be SEEN standing on the porch, beneath the jawb
Caps and gowns -- kids and parents on the lawn -- taking Kelly poses with Sandra.  Tom Baxter aims the camera.
Smile.
Kelly and Sandra force miserable smiles.  CLICK.
That's one for the scrapbook.
Baxter moves away, greets Nicole and her parents. Kelly puts some room between her and Sandra.
You didn't have to fly back -- from -- wherever, for me...
I'm here to congratulate my friends and their children.  I'm leaving again tonight.
Don't bother.  I'm taking a trip.
Where, the mall?
A friend of mine bought a boat.
Sandra shakes her head, walks off. Kelly turns away, freezes, as she catches sight of -- Ray talking with Jimmy.
Ray and Jimmy walk along the sand, moving in the directio big rocks.  Jimmy wears sagger shorts, a surfer T-shirt. wears a suit.  He carries the coat over his shoulder.
It's those rocks, up there.
You and Suzie used to come out here together?
Yeah, sometimes.  Lots of the kids hang out here. (beat) You really think something bad happened to Suzie?
(ignoring the question) Lombardo ever come out here?
Jimmy looks at him, surprised, sees that Ray is serious. the idea generates a laugh.
I say something funny?
No.  But I mean... just the idea that Mr. Lombardo would...
Way I hear it, he was pretty tight with the kids, one of the guys...
Yeah, but...

He breaks off as Ray kneels over a big flat rock.  Ray br away some sand, drapes the sport coat over his arm, takin tweezers and latex gloves from the pockets. Jimmy moves closer, curious, seeing what Ray sees.

as tweezers pick up two teeth from a crevice in the stone Ray straightens, holding the teeth in the palm of his han Jimmy stares at the teeth. Ray takes a couple of bills from his pocket, hands them t
I'm going to be staying here, Jimmy. You can catch a bus up there at the lot, okay?
Jimmy looks a little sick, but he takes the money.  He st toward the lot. Ray watches for a moment.  Then calls out to him.
People aren't always what they appear to be, kid.  Remember it.
Jimmy looks at him, trying to make sense of what Ray is s clearly disturbed by the implications.  But he asks no mo questions.  He turns, trudging alone back through the san
THE TEETH go into a plastic bag.

Black-and-whites, county cars -- police tape across the s Ray, Gloria and Hunter watch as DAVE MERRITT, a forensic bags the teeth.  He passes the bag to Ray, then bends to rocks where he begins to take a blood sample.
Lonbardo and Kelly killed her here.
Hunter and Gloria exchange a look.
Two kids could've gotten into a fight, lost a couple of teeth.
Those are Suzie Toller's teeth.
Where's the body?
The swamp, most likely... Lombardo's a swamp rat, knows the body will never be found there.  But he's made a mistake.
He holds up the evidence bag containing the teeth.
Her grandmother said she'd been threatening to run away.  And I found the car at the Miami bus terminal.
You don't think Sam could've put it there?
Dust it for prints.  My guess is, if anybody murdered Suzie it was probably that little sociopath Kelly Van Ryan.
Ray shakes his head; he turns to Dave, still working.
How soon can we get something?
We can get blood type right away. Dental records will take longer.  You want DNA, that can take weeks.
Ray nods, looks out to sea.
Poor dumb Suzie, she never had a chance.
We don't know that, Ray...
Ray turns to her -- an intense look.
Kelly's next, Gloria.
(ice cold) Get off this Ray, now. (beat) If there is any evidence here, it's for Homicide. (turning to Dave) You get an ID, you call me.
Dave nods.  Hunter stalks off toward his car.  Ray turns Gloria.
Will you do me one favor?
Ray, you heard him...
What if I'm right, Gloria?  What if I'm right and Hunter's wrong? (beat) What do you do if you see a bad thing coming?
Gloria looks toward the highway, trying to decide.
Stick with me on this Gloria.  I need you...
And if the teeth aren't Suzie's?  You'll give this up?
If I'm wrong about those teeth -- it's a promise.
Sam's Jeep -- a "FOR SALE" sign in the window -- sits in Across the road -- Gloria sits in the white Taurus.
Ray sits in his truck, picks up his cellular, punches in number.
(speaker) Merritt, Forensics.
The teeth doin' any talkin'?
Ray.  Stop calling.  I told you the dental records will take time...
What about the blood?
(a beat) Could be hers.  Types match.  Could be a lot of other people's too...
(cutting him off) Second you get something on those teeth, I want it
Ray hangs up without waiting for a reply.  He turns to th Ryan house, an orange light slanting across its facade.

Gloria waits in her car.  She looks toward the motel. Sam's Jeep is parked before one of the bungalows.  There light on in the room.  We can SEE inside. Gloria sighs, picks up a pair of binoculars and trains th the room.
Suitcases and boxes are stacked everywhere.  Sam, bare-ch in khaki slacks, moves about the room.
watching Sam, as...
The PHONE has begun to RING.  Sam looks at it until it st then picks it up and dials a number.  Kelly answers.
Hello?
Hello.
God, I've been calling you.
Kelly is in the guest house, pacing in front of the gun c
I'm really serious.  That cop, he keeps watching me.
Duquette.  Forget him...
I can't help it.  He gives me the creeps... I mean why was Suzie so scared of him?  She's not that way.  I think he did something...
Yeah, he got her busted for possession...
I don't know... I think it was something else... Suzie says the bust was bullshit...
And you believe her?
(a long beat -- a sigh) I don't know. (beat) I want to see you...
Kelly... Relax.  Take one of your mom's valium or something.  In another week you get on the plane.  It's over.  We're rich.
But what if they find out... God, they'd put you in the gas chamber...
Sam is about to respond, then looks out the window, sees. ACROSS THE STREET, the white Taurus.
So if they're tapping your phone, we're dead.  Stay in the guest house.  Skip the graduation parties.  You'll never see Duquette.  Okay?  I love you.
(beat) Okay.  I love you too.

sees the light go out in Sam's room, lowers her binocular for a moment, then begins to write something on a pad. She's still at it when something KNOCKS at a FENDER.  She up, startled, to find... Sam in the street, still shirtless, his arms and shoulder back-lit by the neon light of the Glades Motel.
Isn't that against the law, peeking into windows?
(a long beat) Suzie Toller is missing.
Sam lets out his breath, shakes his head.
How long?
She didn't cone home last night.  We found her car at the bus terminal, but nothing to suggest she bought a ticket.
Maybe she used another name.
Ray thinks she was murdered.
Sam shakes his head once more.
I don't know what to say...
You could tell me where you were last night.
Sam stares at her.
Goddannit... I don't have to...
He stops himself, calms down.
Come here.  I want you to see something.
Gloria hesitates, looks up at Sam, then puts down the pho opens her door.
Sam and Gloria walk among the boxes and suitcases.
Looks like goodbye.
Sam nods.  He goes to one of his cardboard filing boxes, out a file, hands it to Gloria.  As she takes it, he goes closet, takes a shirt from a hanger.
Kelly's file.  Read it.  You're going to find an angry, sexually confused girl who's made threats on her mother's life and a female lover she'd never identify.
Suzie?
Sam shrugs.
You're telling me Ray thinks Suzie was killed.  I don't have to ask you who he thinks did it, do I? (beat) All I'm saying is, read that, you'll have a new perspective on things.
Gloria sits on the bed, the file in her hand.  She watche pulls on the shirt.
Why didn't you tell us about this before the trial?
Sam holds her eyes.
Then -- I still had ethical standards to protect.  They meant a lot to me.  Now, I don't care.  And no amount of money can buy that back.
Sam is interrupted by the HONKING of a HORN.  He looks ou
A taxi waits in the glow of the green neon. Sam looks down on Gloria, seated on his bed, her skirt sh enough to REVEAL shapely legs.  For a moment the two hold another's eyes.
My ride.  If you're not planning on arresting me, that is.
The PHONE RINGS.  Ray picks it up.
Ray.  What's happening?
She's still in Sam's room, the file spread across the bed
I'm tired, Ray.  I'm going home.
Where's Lombardo?
He's leaving the country.  And I don't give a shit.
The blood type on the rocks matches Suzie's.
It's Homicide's job now, Ray, let 'em do it.  I'll tell you something else, there's more to this story than you know, Ray... If Suzie is dead, I think Hunter may be on the right track...
Ray clicks off his phone.
Ray? (nothing but dial tone) Shit.  Ray.
Ray gets out of his car, presses the intercom.
(intercom) Who is it?
(into intercom) Detective Duquette, Ms. Van Ryan.  Let me in.  Now.
Ray CROSSES the deck, Sandra at his heels.
Where is she?
Where she lives.  In the guest house. Now will you tell me what this is about?
I'm placing your daughter under arrest.
You can't...
(turning, cutting her off) Suzie Toller is dead.  You don't want Kelly to be next, then take my advice. Stay out of my way.
A cap and gown lay strewn on the sofa. Kelly wears jeans and a bra.  She looks up to see Ray mov across the tile.  Her eyes go wide, then move to the gun
Sandra stands near the jacuzzi, not exactly sure what to watching as...

Ray knocks at the French door.  It swings open.  He steps A long moment, then VOI?ES, the SOUND of things being kno about, BREAKING GLASS. Sandra starts toward the house then stops at the SOUND of single GUNSHOT. A SECOND GUNSHOT follows, then a THIRD. The guest house door opens.  Ray stumbles out, his should bloody, a .357 in his hand.
We SEE him from the waist up -- a white T-shirt, his shou bandaged, his arm in a sling.  There are red scratch mark face.  His eyes look blankly into the camera.
I fucked up.  I lost control of the situation, the one thing they train you for... God, what did I do?
Just tell us what happened.
I told Kelly Van Ryan she was under arrest for conspiracy and murder.  I did her rights.
Perfect crescent of sand.  A man in white shorts reclines beach chair, beneath a gaily-colored umbrella, sipping a
Kelly went crazy, started screaming.  I grabbed her, put her on the floor.

Sam, in white shorts, looking good, watches a beautiful i girl in a thong bikini frolic in the surf. She seems to sense Sam watching, turns toward the beach. eyes meet Sam's.  She breaks into a beautiful smile.
She bit you?
Bit, scratched.  But I had her pinned. She calmed down.  I was going to cuff her... She said she thought she was going to be sick.  She asked to use the bathroom.
Sam and the island girl sit at an outdoor table.  The gir a short, terry cloth robe, Sam the white shorts and a flo shirt.  They sip drinks.  Their eyes meet.  Their fingers
I told her I was coming with her.  She nodded, like she understood.  We stood up together.
You didn't cuff her?

She looked shaky, but lucid.  I thought, I would just go with her, stand at the door... (shaking his head) I think I looked away.  A split second. Then, bingo.  Just like that.  She puts a knee into my groin. (beat) There was this coffee table between us and the wall.  She got one foot on that thing and launched herself at the gun case.  Thing had a glass door.  I could hear it breaking. (beat) I didn't go down, but she slowed me up, just enough.  Before I could get to her, she'd turned on me with this small caliber handgun.  I yelled at her to put it down.  She got off a shot.  I took it in the shoulder.  I... I had no choice. I returned fire.  Two rounds, I think. In the chest.
A moment of silence, save for the BUZZING of the MACHINE. number of plainclothes police, Hunter and Gloria among th watch the tape.
I went there to protect her...
He hangs his head, then looks up, his eyes focusing.
The teeth, were they...
Suzie Toller's.  And that's the only thing saving your sorry ass.
Brilliant sun on turquoise water.  A few boats anchored i lagoon.  A quiet place. Heading out -- a forty-foot sloop, Sam at the helm.

Gloria, Baxter, a tearful Sandra, sit in seats, watch as Ray stands before a panel, A SUIT, A CHIEF in uniform, Hu Ray wears a suit, his hair neatly trimmed.  His arm is no in a sling, but one of his hands is still bandaged.

Detective Duquette; our investigation concludes that this was a good shooting. But that's irrelevant.  You were not assigned to this case -- whatever you imagined this case to be.  And now two young women are dead.  You are terminated with forfeiture of pension and benefits.
Ray looks at the floor. Hunter coughs.  His hands rest on a file -- we SEE the vi cassette inside -- labeled "TOLLER/VAN RYAN -- CONFIDENTI

Suzie Toller's teeth and blood were found near the area known as Stoner Rocks.  Suzie's blood was found in the Van Ryan Range Rover.  This, in conjunction with evidence obtained by Detectives Duquette and Perez has led this office to the conclusion that Susan Marie Toller was murdered by Kelly Lanier Van Ryan...

Sandra chokes back a sob.  She gets to her feet, to be le the room by Tom Baxter. Gloria Perez watches, a sad look in her eye, then turns t at Ray.  His back is to her -- the broad shoulders, expen suit.  His hands are clasped behind his back.

Gloria stands among a considerable number of mourners.  S just back from Sandra and Tom Baxter, who, in turn, are j from the open grave. As Gloria watches, Sandra looks off to the side, where so catches her eye.  Gloria sees her start, then follows her

On a rise some fifty yards from the Van Ryan plot, two pe stand near an old oak -- Ruby and Walter. When Gloria looks back at Sandra, it seems to her as if t has slumped against Tom Baxter, who now stares at the two on the rise as if, by doing so with sufficient intensity, might make them disappear. Gloria turns to the grave site, her eye lingers on the op grave, then moves to the huge marker which dominates the family plot and, in fact, the entire scene.
The angel Gabriel, trumpet in hand, carved in relief upon obelisk of black marble.  Beneath the angel is a carved s and upon it the words: "I AM THE RESURRECTION AND THE LIFE," and below that:  "W

head_text.subj: TECUMSEH VAN RYAN. MAY HE REST IN PEACE."

text: Sam Lombardo walks along a moonlit lagoon, headed toward bungalow. The bungalow is simple, picturesque -- whitewashed walls, thatched roof.  A patio opens onto the beach.
As Sam steps in off the sand, he sees something and stops Wet spots lead toward the bungalow. Sam listens.  Everything is quiet.

Sam ENTERS in a room lit only by the blue light of a larg aquarium.  He listens once more, hears it -- RUNNING WATE He moves down a short hallway, observes the light which s from beneath a bedroom door.  He pushes it open, goes ins
He CROSSES the room. The bathroom door is ajar, the room leaking steam.

Sam steps inside, looks at the shower stall -- an indisti shape moves there in the steam. San watches, then jerks open the shower door.  The steam clears -- REVEALING a tall, athletic body, and now the fa Ray Duquette, grinning at Sam out of the swirling steam.
Buy you a drink?
San takes a step back.
Jesus.  I wasn't expecting you 'til tomorrow.

Ray turns off the water, steps out of the stall, wrapping in a towel.  There's a fresh, raised scar across one shou Ray winces a little as he tucks the towel about his waist looks at himself in the mirror, touching the scar.
Nice girlfriend you had there.
Sam just looks at him.
Yeah, well, you fixed that. (beat) What the hell happened, anyway?
The bitch shot me, is what happened.
Sam shakes his head, walks back into the bedroom.  Ray fo
Hey, what did you want me to do, die?
Well, shit, you're the cop, they don't teach you to disarm people, shoot them in the leg or something?  You weren't supposed to kill her for Christ's sake.
Now Ray just looks at Sam, his eyes narrowing.

Did you become squeamish about these things before or after you bludgeoned little Suzie Toller to death with a wine bottle? (off Sam's silence) Jesus, man. It couldn't have worked out better. They're convinced Kelly whacked Suzie. I can't talk 'em out of it. (beat) We should be celebrating.  This thing worked out just like you said, only better.
Kelly was supposed to be framed, not killed. (beat) What I'm telling you is, I don't like surprises.
Ray walks to a dresser where a bottle of champagne sits i bucket of ice.  He opens the bottle, fills two glasses. one of the glasses to Sam.
Every cloud has a silver lining, partner.  Here's to no loose ends.
He raises his glass in a toast. Sam looks at it, then raises his glass as well.  Ray smil doesn't.
Here's to no more surprises.
Ray shrugs.  The two men's eyes meet.  They touch glasses drink.
Sam and Ray work on the deck of Sam's sloop, stowing gear loading supplies. The boat's mast shines in the sunlight before a brilliant Palms sway.  The men work in silence.

Gloria drives up in the white Taurus.  She parks before t ramshackle old building and the gator pen. Walter is in the pen.  Ruby stands just outside of it.  S toward the road as Gloria gets out, then back to the pen. Gloria comes down the bank to stand beside Ruby.  She's j time to see the huge old reptile raise itself, hissing, o front legs, jaws sprung wide.  The women watch as Walter his arm into the gator's mouth.
Gator can't see what's in front of it for shit.  They see out the sides. (beat) That one don't even know Walter's arm's in his mouth.
What if something distracts it and it snaps anyway?
Then I guess Walter can kiss that arm of his goodbye. (loud enough for Walter to hear) He don't use it for no good deeds anyway.
Walter looks at the ladies, picks up the stick and sweeps between the gaping jaws, which snap in its wake.
You come all the way out here to watch Walter?
I was wondering if I could ask you a few questions.
About Suzie?
Actually, I was wondering if I might ask you about Ray Duquette.
(a long beat) He used to come around here.  He had a thing going with one of the girls over at the Glades.
Ruby nods toward the motel, a bitter smile on her face.
Got sort of hung up on her, from what hear.
She still work there?

No.  Not after that night. (a long beat) I don't know what happened.  Maybe he caught her with some john... All I know is, the next morning the girl was gone and there was a dead boy... Indian kid named Davy.  Used to live down the road there in a wrecked car. Him and Suzie were at the Glades that night. (beat) It was right after that, Ray got Suzie busted and sent her away.  That's what there is to say about Ray Duquette.
Was there ever any kind of investigation...
Ruby cuts her off with a short laugh.

Duquette always claimed the kid was dusted, came after him with a knife. But it was Jack's Fish Camp... This could be the moon for all most people care. (a long beat) Wasn't supposed to be like that though. This place was supposed to be something once.  There were going to be roads and houses.  There was going to be a town. They were going to call it Salt Creek.

From the surface of the sea -- the emerald island in the distance.  The bow of the sloop comes INTO FRAME. On board -- Sam stands in the cockpit, at the helm.  Ray on the deck.  The boat sails easily before the wind.
Ray... you see that winch by your head? Take a couple of turns on it for me, she's luffing.
Ray cranes his neck to look at the winch.
You mean this thing?
Yes, we call it a winch. (pointing at pieces of the rigging) And these are shrouds, and these are stays.
I thought this was supposed to be a vacation.  Why didn't you buy a nice big power boat?
Come on, man.  I'll make a sailor out of you yet.
Yeah, or get me drowned.

Ray kneels.  He begins to tighten the winch. Sam watches him for a moment, then reaches around behind to unhook the short line which holds the boom. The mainsail catches wind, swinging the boom in a wide ar directly at Ray. Ray looks up, sees it coming just in time to catch it on The blow is enough to send him sprawling through the life where he just manages to grab one of the nylon cords. Sam ducks as the boon continues to swing erratically abov deck, watching as Ray hauls himself on board. The boat no longer driven by the wind, bobs up and down o small ground swell. The two men face each other.
Jesus, man... You okay?
That how you planned it?  You take cut Suzie, get me to hang it on Kelly, then dump me in the ocean...
Come off it, man... It was an accident.

Ray nods, then reaches down, pulls off the winch handle a starts with it toward Sam. Sam looks around.  He jerks open a storage compartment. diver's weight belt tumbles out.  Sam grabs it, swings it his head in circles, letting the weight pick up momentum, preparing to throw. Ray crouches, still brandishing the winch handle.  The bo sweeps the deck. Sam throws the belt. Ray grabs a shroud, dances out of the way, then steadies a mean grin spreading across his face. There's no tine for Sam to look for anything else. Ray moves quickly across the deck -- a menacing sight -- well-muscled, the handle gleaming in his hand. Sam pulls himself out of the cockpit.  Ray jumps in.  But as far as he gets. WHOOSH -- A spear pierces Ray's thigh.  He screams, goes the handle skittering across the deck. Ray follows it with his eyes, reaching out, then freezing sees something else.  He draws in his hand as if bitten.
You... You're...
He scuttles backward, pulling himself onto the deck, clut his leg which squirts blood as if an artery has been seve But his eyes never leave the hatchway leading belowdecks.
You're dead... for godsake...

The boat heels over.  The spear in Ray's thigh bangs agai edge of the cockpit.  He grimaces in pain as... Suzie Toller steps up from belowdecks.  She's wearing a b and showing a nice tan.  She's carrying Sam's new spear g fresh spear at the ready.
Rumors of my demise have been greatly exaggerated. (to Sam) Nice move.  Good thing I was here to save your incompetent ass.
Sam secures the boom.  Ray stares at Suzie, his face twis some combination of pain, rage and fear.
You... I should've killed you myself. should never have left it up to him...
Shoulda, coulda, woulda... (to Sam) Get him in the water.
San starts for Ray.
Sam, for Christ's sake...
Sam's feet slide in the bloody smear.  He stops. Ray clings to a safety line.
I can't.

WHOOSH -- A second spear penetrates Ray's shoulder.  He l grip.  The boat heels over, dumping Ray into the water. Suzie puts down her spear gun.  She goes to a storage loc takes out a bait bucket.  She steps up on the deck. Ray is floating not far from the boat, the water going re him.  He calls out...
Sam, for godsake.
Hey, Ray.  Guess whose name is on the numbered bank account besides yours and Sam's?
She raises the bucket, heaves bloody chum into the water.
I like these joint survivorship accounts.  Something unfortunate happens to one of the signatories, the others don't have to worry.  Are you worrying, Ray?
She heaves more chum -- a big red slurp across Ray's face Ray gasps, goes under, thrashing around in the red slick.

from underwater, in a frenzy, rip a human body into a blo cloud.
